intro: Clidemia striphnocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a soft, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests and disturbed habitats. Clidemia striphnocalyx is also known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative propagation.
